loopRepeats.label: Loop repeats
loopRepeats.help: This number defines how many times the entire queue will be reprinted.
loopRepeats.example: Example: Plate "A" is set to 3 repeats, plate "B" is set to 1 repeat and the "Loop repeats" is set to 2. This will result in following printing order:
loopRepeats.exampleOrder: A A A B A A A B .

plateSettings.title: Plate Settings
plateSettings.instruction: Click on a plate above to configure its settings

nozzleFilament.title: Nozzle & Filament
nozzleFilament.hideLoadLine: Hide nozzle load line in model
nozzleFilament.hideLoadLineHelp: Activate this option to achieve the correct nozzle pressure when starting a new print. If deactivated, this may cause slight under-extrusion at the bottom of the first object.
nozzleFilament.purgeOffHelp: Disable the filament purge sequence at the start of this plate. This can speed up multi-plate jobs but might cause issues if the plate before used different materials.

pushoff.title: Push-off & Ejection
pushoff.bedRaiseOffsetHelp: Defines how much the bed is raised before performing the push-out sequence.
pushoff.waitMinutesBeforeSwapHelp: This setting allows you to set up a delay to allow the plate to cool down before the swap. This is appropriate for large parts that tend to warp.
pushoff.securePushoffHelp: When enabled, the app performs multiple controlled push‑offs at decreasing Z heights before the final push at Z=1. This helps avoid collisions and smooths the ejection.
pushoff.additionalLevelsHelp: Defines how the maximum Z height is divided. Example: if max Z is 100 mm and you enter 2, push‑offs occur around Z≈50 and the final one at Z=1. If you enter 5, there will be 5 extra push‑offs, with the last always at Z=1. A value of 1 means only a final push at Z=1.

dontSwapLastPlate.title: Plate Swap Behavior
dontSwapLastPlate.enableHelp: When this setting is activated, it will keep the last plate on the heat bed without swapping. This is reasonable when rails are used but the space is limited.

cooling.title: Cooling & Bed Temperature
cooling.raiseBedHelp: Activate this option to raise the bed to fan height for faster cooling. Warning: For large prints the printer cover must be removed to avoid collision.
cooling.targetTempHelp: Specifies the bed temperature that should be reached before the push-out sequence.
cooling.maxTimeHelp: Defines the maximum cooldown duration in minutes. The app will insert repeated M190 commands to wait for the bed until this total time is reached. Default is 40 minutes.

sounds.title: Printer Sounds
sounds.disableHelp: Controls printer sound removal for A1/A1M printers. When enabled, you can choose to remove all sounds or only sounds between plates. This setting only affects A1/A1M printers.

ams.title: AMS Optimization
ams.enableHelp: When on, the app automatically removes redundant AMS filament swaps between plates. This eliminates unnecessary "unload all" + "load same slot" sequences, making multi-plate prints more efficient. Only available for A1/A1M printers.

startsequence.title: Startsequence
startsequence.disableBedLevelingHelp: When on, bed leveling is skipped for all plates after the first one. This speeds up multi-plate printing by reusing the leveling data from the first plate. Only available for X1/P1 printers in push-off mode.
startsequence.disableFirstLayerScanHelp: When on, the first layer inspection scan is disabled. This can speed up the print start but removes the automatic quality check. Only available for X1 printers in push-off mode.
startsequence.vibrationCalibrationOnlyOnceHelp: When on, the vibration calibration is performed only for the first plate. This speeds up multi-plate printing. Available for X1/P1/A1 printers.

project.title: Project Settings
project.overrideMetadataHelp: When on, the app regenerates the filament entries and material/printer settings. This is essential if you use new AMS slot assignments that weren't present in the original G-code. When off, the original 3MF metadata is kept as-is; if you remap to AMS slots that weren't originally defined, the printer or Studio may report a mismatch.

progress.title: Progress Display
progress.percentageProgressHelp: Controls how percentage and time remaining are calculated:
progress.perPlateDesc: Progress shows percentage/time for current plate only (default behavior)
progress.globalDesc: Progress shows overall percentage/time across all plates in the queue
progress.helpText:
Controls how percentage and time remaining are calculated:
  • Per plate: Progress shows percentage/time for current plate only (default behavior)
  • Global: Progress shows overall percentage/time across all plates in the queue
progress.layerProgressHelp: Controls how layer counting is displayed:
progress.layerPerPlateDesc: Resets to layer 0 at the start of each plate
progress.layerGlobalDesc: Continuous layer counting across all plates
progress.layerHelpText:
Controls how layer counting is displayed:
  • Per plate: Resets to layer 0 at the start of each plate
  • Global: Continuous layer counting across all plates

file.title: File Settings
file.testExportHelp: When enabled, exports only the start and end sequences without the actual print code. This creates a small test file perfect for verifying plate-swap logic without running a full print. The test file will go through all plate changes but skip the actual object printing.

developer.title: Developer Settings
developer.enableHelp: When on, shows advanced developer options like override metadata and test file generation. Only enable this if you need access to these experimental features.

supportedPrinters.title: Supported Printers
supportedPrinters.intro: This app supports the following Bambu Lab printer models:
supportedPrinters.a1mini: A1 Mini - SWAP mode with Swapmod system
supportedPrinters.a1: A1 - SWAP mode with JoBox, 3Print, or Printflow systems
supportedPrinters.x1: X1 Series - Push-off mode (direct push-off with print head)
supportedPrinters.p1: P1 Series - Push-off mode (direct push-off with print head)
supportedPrinters.autoDetect: The app automatically detects your printer model from the GCODE file.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.step1: Load your files: Drag & drop your sliced .gcode.3mf files from Bambu Studio or Orca Slicer into the drop zone above.
gettingStarted.step1important: Important: Only fully sliced project files (format: filename.gcode.3mf) are accepted. Unsliced 3D model files or plain .gcode files are not supported.
gettingStarted.step2: Printer detection: The app automatically detects your printer model and shows the corresponding mode (A1 Mini, X1, or P1).
gettingStarted.step3: Configure settings: Adjust options in the Settings panel that appears below your loaded plates.
gettingStarted.step4: Export: Click "Generate SWAP file" or "Export GCODE" to create your processed files.

automation.title: Automatisation Mode
automation.intro: This app supports both plate-swapper systems (Swapmod, JoBox, 3Print, Printflow) and direct push-off with the print head.
automation.a1mini: A1 Mini (SWAP Mode): Creates .swap.3mf files for automatic plate swapping using Swapmod system
automation.a1: A1 (SWAP Mode): Supports JoBox, 3Print, and Printflow systems for automatic plate swapping
automation.x1p1: X1/P1 Series (Push-off Mode): Generates modified GCODE with automated push-off sequences using the print head
automation.a1miniSwitch: A1 Mini: Only Swapmod is available - no mode selection needed
automation.a1Switch: A1: Click the logos (JoBox, 3Print, Printflow) at the top to switch between different plate-swapper systems. IMPORTANT: You must select the correct mode that matches your physically installed plate-swapper system. Using the wrong mode can cause serious damage to your printer!
automation.x1p1Switch: X1/P1: Uses push-off mode exclusively - no mode selection needed

plates.title: Working with Plates
plates.select: Select plates: Click on any plate to select it and configure plate-specific settings
plates.repeat: Repeat count: Change the number next to each plate to print it multiple times
plates.remove: Remove plates: Click the "×" button in the top-right corner of any plate
plates.duplicate: Duplicate plates: Click the "+" button on the plate image to make a copy
plates.reorder: Reorder plates: Drag and drop plates in the list to rearrange the printing order

filament.title: Filament & AMS Slots
filament.changeSlot: Change slot assignment: Click any colored filament swatch on a plate to reassign it to a different AMS slot (1-4)
filament.globalColors: Global slot colors: Click color swatches in "Filament usage statistics" to customize global slot colors
filament.tracking: Usage tracking: View total filament consumption per slot in the statistics area

settingsPanel.title: Settings Panel Options
settingsPanel.generalCustomName: Custom file name: Set your preferred output filename
settingsPanel.generalLoopRepeats: Loop repeats: Number of times to repeat the entire print queue
settingsPanel.generalTestExport: Test file export: Generate a test file with only start/end sequences for debugging. This creates a small file that goes through all plate-swap sequences without printing the actual objects. Perfect for testing your setup without wasting time or material. You can configure the wait time between plates in the "Test file wait time" setting (default: 30 seconds).
settingsPanel.plateSpecificIntro: Click on a plate above to access these settings:
settingsPanel.plateSpecificObjects: Object count & coordinates: Configure number of objects on the plate and their X positions
settingsPanel.plateSpecificNozzle: Nozzle & filament settings: Control purge sequences and nozzle behavior per plate
settingsPanel.plateSpecificPushoff: Push-off settings: Customize ejection behavior for each individual plate
settingsPanel.advancedBedLeveling: "Disable bed leveling between plates" - Skips bed leveling for all plates after the first one. This can speed up multi-plate printing by reusing the leveling data from the initial print. Theory: The bed was already leveled at print initialization, so re-leveling between plates should not be necessary. Risk: There is a small risk that the push-off process may have affected the print head's leveling calibration. Use this option if print speed is more important than maximum reliability.
settingsPanel.advancedFirstLayer: "Disable first layer scan" - Disables the first layer inspection scan. This speeds up print start but removes the automatic quality check. Use this if you consider the scan to be unnecessary or if you prefer speed over the additional quality assurance.
settingsPanel.advancedPurge: "Turn off filament purge" - Skips purge sequence after first plate (faster multi-plate jobs). Only enable if there are no filament changes between plates.
settingsPanel.advancedLoadLine: "Hide nozzle load line in model" - Extrudes extra material at print start to compensate for the removed load line. Prevents under-extrusion on the object's bottom layer, but may be visible if print start is at the object's edge.
settingsPanel.advancedCooling: "Raise Bed Level for cooling" - Moves bed to fan height for faster cooling. For tall objects, remove the printer's top glass cover to prevent collisions.
settingsPanel.advancedSecurePushoff: "Secure push‑off sequence" - Uses controlled push-offs at multiple heights to guarantee safe ejection of finished objects from the printer
settingsPanel.advancedOverride: "Override project & filament settings" - Regenerates metadata for new slot assignments. This option becomes necessary when AMS slots are redefined.
settingsPanel.cooldownSoundTarget: Target bed temperature: Cool down to this temperature before push-out (default: 23°C)
settingsPanel.cooldownSoundMax: Max cooldown time: Maximum time to wait for cooling (default: 40 minutes)
settingsPanel.cooldownSoundSounds: Printer sounds: Disable all sounds or only sounds between plates (A1/A1M only)
settingsPanel.cooldownSoundAms: AMS optimization: Remove redundant filament swaps between plates (A1/A1M only)
settingsPanel.progressDisplayPerPlate: Percentage Progress - Per plate: Shows progress percentage and time remaining for the current plate only (default behavior)
settingsPanel.progressDisplayGlobal: Percentage Progress - Global: Shows overall progress percentage and time remaining across all plates in the entire queue. Useful for tracking the total job completion.

dataSecurity.title: Data security
dataSecurity.content: This app uses your browser as an environment and runs locally on your computer. This means none of your data is sent to our server or any third party cloud provider. You can even save this app as a web page and use it completely offline. This site also does not use cookies or store any personal information on your device.

errors.defaultError: Please use sliced files in *.3mf or *.gcode.3mf formats. Usage of plane *.gcode files is not supported.
errors.printerNotSupported: This printer model is not supported yet in this app (file: {{fileName}}).
errors.missingCoordinates: Warning: Some X coordinates are missing (0). Please enter valid values before exporting.
errors.swapModeOnlyA1: SWAP Mode is only available for A1 Mini and A1 printers. For other printers, please use Push Off Mode.
errors.incompatibleSlots: Incompatible AMS slots detected. This plate uses slots that are not compatible with previous plates. Please check your filament configuration.
errors.tooManyColors: Too many different colors/materials detected. The printer supports only 4 AMS slots.
errors.colorConflict: Color conflict detected. Different materials are assigned to the same slot.
errors.slotMismatch: AMS slot mismatch detected between plates.

supportedPrinters.title: Supported Printers
supportedPrinters.intro: This app supports the following Bambu Lab printer models:
supportedPrinters.a1Mini: A1 Mini - SWAP mode with Swapmod system
supportedPrinters.a1: A1 - SWAP mode with JoBox, 3Print, or Printflow systems
supportedPrinters.x1: X1 Series - Push-off mode (direct push-off with print head)
supportedPrinters.p1: P1 Series - Push-off mode (direct push-off with print head)
supportedPrinters.autoDetect: The app automatically detects your printer model from the GCODE file.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.step1:
Load your files: Drag & drop your sliced .gcode.3mf files from Bambu Studio or Orca Slicer into the drop zone above.
Important: Only fully sliced project files (format: filename.gcode.3mf) are accepted. Unsliced 3D model files or plain .gcode files are not supported.
gettingStarted.step2: Printer detection: The app automatically detects your printer model and shows the corresponding mode (A1 Mini, X1, or P1).
gettingStarted.step3: Configure settings: Adjust options in the Settings panel that appears below your loaded plates.
gettingStarted.step4: Export: Click "Generate SWAP file" or "Export GCODE" to create your processed files.

automation.a1: A1 (SWAP Mode): Supports JoBox, 3Print, and Printflow systems for automatic plate swapping
